Have you leveraged the blueprint package for this?

Good question, I have not yet, but will consider it. Note that blueprint is less about Databricks Apps and more about stand-alone, usually CLI or job based projects (like DQX or UCX). Many of the included batteries will go unused likely. But it raises the question if we should extract building blocks for Apps into blueprints. Maybe @andre.furlan@databricks.com can chime in here?

Can we get a few lines on what each customer's use case is. Ontos seems like a very comprehensive solution, so it would be interesting to understand if these 7 customers are interested in it for the same functionality, or certain functionality for some of them.

All customers are primarily interested in the Data Product part. Most know about the BITOL ODCS and ODPS and the tooling around it. They want to have a business semantics layer, which is an RDF-based graph linking business concepts to data assets, with an abstraction layer for the value chain in the form of data products.
I'll also add the other category of customer which includes Novo Nordisk/Vanguard/Broadridge etc who wants to be able to link their data to industry standard ontologies and discover it that way
I added Telstra to that list as I had a call with Accenture supporting them to build a semantic layer.
Added Hapag-Lloyd that @karthik.subbarao@databricks.com demoed to. Thanks Karthik!

@jason@databricks.com I’m not sure this strategy is the right one, because it risks Labs projects never being able to reach a v1.0 milestone. If a project is already part of the product, why should it continue to live indefinitely under the Labs label?

Take DQX as an example: customers are already asking when it will reach v1.0. In this context, they're not referring to production-grade support, but rather to the maturity and stability of the project. Using v1.0 to signal a stable, usable state—even while still in Labs—would better align with customer expectations and provide clearer messaging around project readiness.
Note: The Marketplace team is already aware of Ontos and offered it to be the fourth app to be published there. Exciting!!!
How does it compare with One Data? https://onedata.ai/
We have to handle this differently for applications. PyPI is for libraries.
UC is adding RBAC. Do these Ontos roles map to the UC roles, or is it duplicative?

RBAC is a technical solution, helping to restrict access to well-defined privilege sets (think our exclusive groups approach, aka AssumeRole). Ontos supports business roles instead, that is, staff acting in some capacity to solve a data governance problem. This includes the recurring task of reviewing and approving/denying access to data assets. These are not just Delta tables, but really ANY asset, including code (notebooks, functions). It offers an internal ITSM process to do so, since external ITSM systems are often overloaded and convoluted, also often requiring IT to implement the various API calls between systems. This is nuts.

Related to this is of course ABAC and the semantic tags captured by Ontos can be used to provide semantically driven data access management, which is a key part of the more general concept of Ontology Based Data Management (OBDM) which several customers are actively exploring (e.g. https://www.linkedin.com/posts/janbeger_digital-evolution-novo-nordisks-shift-to-ugcPost-7313458579670233089-EWQU)
@jason@databricks.com Sounds like this needs to be updated for Apps (as in, true ones that stay an app), as they are not merged into the code base.
